answers.answer: Hello,the sugar in the urine could be related to infection.However, given the history of recurrent infection I would want to get some more testing / monitoring.When was the 115 reading compared to her last meal?At least a test called HBA1C should be done.  This gives average blood sugar over the past few months.  Truely normal should be in the range of 4.3 - 4.6.  Anything above 5 merits closer watching.In the meantime avoid sweets and portion control for other carbs.Let us know how she goes.

question: I brought my 7 yr old daughter to the dr today because she was complaining that it burned when she pees. She has a history of bladder and kidney infections. She has already been hospitalized with psuedomonis infection. They did a urine test and it came back that she did have an infection and there was sugar in her urine. They then proceeded to check her blood and the level came back at 115. They said that was normal. He said for me to watch her sugar intake because its a sign of diabetes. He didnt seem too concerned but i am. everywhere i look i see diabetes!!
title: Sugar in Urine
